a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Human rights index vs. GDP per capita, 2022
Human rights capture the extent to which citizens enjoy physical integrity rights as well as political and private civil
liberties, with higher scores meaning more rights. GDP per capita data is adjusted for inflation and for differences
in the cost of living between countries.
Data source: V-Dem (2024); Bolt and van Zanden - Maddison Project Database 2023

Note: GDP per capita data is expressed in
international-$
at 2011 prices.
